name: 2022 BMW 4 Series
description:
Overview

Newly redesigned last year, the BMW 4 Series continues to offer the kind of performance, handling, and comfort that's expected from luxury performance vehicles in this price range. The BMW 4 Series is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 2 trim levels. The most popular style is the 430i Convertible RWD, which starts at $54,295 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This 4 Series is estimated to deliver 25 MPG in the city and 34 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Exceptional all-around performance
Wide variety of configurations to suit any taste
Luxurious cabin with high-quality materials throughout

Cons

Cramped backseat in the coupe and convertible
Blinding interior brightwork

Overall Assessment

Coupes used to be all the rage. Now only a few thousand deals cross the salesman's desk every year. Already susceptible to hot-then-not fashion fatigue, the BMW 4 Series sells half (or less) the volume of the BMW 3 Series sedan upon which it is based. But there is something cool about the cleaner lines of a coupe — or convertible in this case.

Competing against the clinical Audi A5, stylish Mercedes-Benz C-Class Coupe, swoopy Lexus RC, and slinky Infiniti Q60, the 4 Series has its work cut out for it. But as the most recently redesigned of the bunch, it has an advantage.

BMW has also reintroduced the 4 Series "Gran Coupe" to the lineup, a four-door hatchback sedan with a sloping roofline (read: less headroom for the second-row occupants). Body style aside, every 4 Series offers swift acceleration, powerful brakes, and a supple suspension that makes for an enjoyable ride no matter the route.

name: 2022 Audi A5
description:
Overview

Three stunning shapes — coupe, convertible, and hatchback — combined with sharp handling and advanced tech make the Audi A5 one of today's best compact sports cars. The Audi A5 is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the Premium Plus Cabriolet 45 TFSI, which starts at $58,195 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This A5 is estimated to deliver 23 MPG in the city and 31 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Sporty handling and performance, boosted by standard all-wheel drive
Premium interior materials
Three body styles to suit most lifestyles

Cons

Some competitors offer more rear passenger room
Scant cargo space in coupe and convertible models
Hefty premium for optional safety features

Overall Assessment

With high-riding SUVs all the rage these days, Audi is one of the few automakers still in the coupe and convertible game. The 2022 Audi A5 blends the brand's trademarks — style, all-wheel-drive handling, technology — into stunning coupe, convertible, and four-door "coupe" shapes. Impeccable cabin design and materials infuse the interior with a luxury feel. Tech and infotainment are rich and full-featured, and while power is modest, the way the A5 slices through turns is joyous.

For 2022, the A5 adds a handful of upgrades. Android Auto, like Apple CarPlay, is now wireless, freeing the center console of cable spaghetti. A now-standard sport suspension sharpens handling for the coupe and Sportback hatch models. The popular Black Optic Plus appearance package is now available for the base Sportback.

Audi isn't the only brand still bullish on coupes and convertibles, of course. Safe to say that if rivals such as BMW, Mercedes-Benz, and Lexus were not also still invested in two-doors and droptops, Audi's boardroom discussions might find renewed focus. But for now, the A5 remains one of the most refreshing alternatives to boxy sedans, sleepy SUVs, and Jeep-y safari cars.

name: 2022 BMW Z4
description:
Overview

Quick, agile, refined, and sophisticated, the BMW Z4 offers an exceptional combination of comfort, sports-car performance, and top-down fun. The BMW Z4 is a 2-seater vehicle that comes in 2 trim levels. The most popular style is the sDriveM40i, which starts at $64,695 and comes with a 3.0L I6 Turbo engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This Z4 is estimated to deliver 22 MPG in the city and 29 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Smooth, powerful engines
Extremely fun to drive
Quiet interior with the top up

Cons

No manual transmission or all-wheel-drive option
Not quite as sporty as some key rivals
Overall Assessment
One of our favorite sports cars, the BMW Z4 is the luxury brand's smallest and least expensive convertible. A rear-wheel-drive two-seat sports car with a folding soft-top roof, the Z4 is all about fun, freedom, and the thrill of the open road, but it's also refined and comfortable. The Z4 offers zesty acceleration and athletic handling. It isn't quite as sporty as its main rival, the Porsche 718 Boxster, but it is a bit more civilized. As a result, the Z4 is more enjoyable in everyday driving than the sportier Porsche. And it's considerably less expensive. The Z4 is also more affordable than the Audi TT, which comes standard with all-wheel drive. That's not available on the BMW or the Porsche. And if you're looking for a Z4-like coupe, consider the Toyota GR Supra. They look nothing alike, but they were co-developed by the two automakers and share basically everything, including their engines.

name: 2022 Mercedes-Benz E-Class
description:
Overview

The 2022 Mercedes-Benz E-Class has an enticing exterior design, impressive interior style, and a stunning level of technological excellence. Some of the tech is hard to use, and the options list gets confusing, yet we still consider it one of the best luxury vehicles in its class. The Mercedes-Benz E-Class is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the AMG E 53 Cabriolet 4MATIC+, which starts at $85,400 and comes with a 3.0L I6 S/C and Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This E-Class is estimated to deliver 21 MPG in the city and 27 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Excellent build quality
Beautifully detailed cabin
Strong yet efficient engines

Cons

Complex infotainment system
Long list of options makes it hard to configure

Overall Assessment

The Mercedes-Benz E-Class is one of the vaunted brand's most versatile vehicles. Each vehicle in the E-Class lineup sets a high standard of excellence by which competitive cars are judged. The E-Class balances leading-edge technology with traditional automotive luxury in a manner that others find difficult to counter. And it does so in sedan, coupe, and wagon body styles that give it a level of flexibility that's rare in the class. All the E-Class variants share common attributes that include classic luxury, innovative technology, rock-solid build quality, and impressive safety. Its rear-drive layout enables the sedan to provide better handling than a front-drive car. While the standard E-Class models offer plenty of driving pleasure, the sport-oriented AMG versions take the driving experience to a higher level.

The E-Class sedan is in the middle of its competitive set in terms of size. It is 1.5 inches shorter than the BMW 5 Series and on par with the Audi A6. The Cadillac CT5 — the only domestic luxury sedan that competes with the E-Class — is half an inch shorter. The visually stunning E-Class coupe is 4 inches shorter than the sedan.

name: 2022 Ford Mustang
description:
Overview

The Ford Mustang still clings to its original formula: a highly styled two-door that puts racing looks and performance ahead of everyday practicality. Among current performance cars, the iconic Mustang is a bargain. The Ford Mustang is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 6 trim levels. The most popular style is the GT Premium Convertible, which starts at $49,460 and comes with a 5.0L V8 engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This Mustang is estimated to deliver 15 MPG in the city and 24 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Wide model range offers a Mustang for every type of buyer
Comfortable front seats
Available as a coupe or convertible

Cons

V8s are thirsty for fuel
Small backseat

Overall Assessment

More than 60 years ago, the Ford Mustang was created with a magic formula that has served it well. It's always been a front-engine, rear-wheel-drive two-door with sporty bucket seats and a small backseat. With a long hood and short rear deck, the Mustang looks powerful and sporty, even in base-level trims. Ford has recently dropped most of its car line, leaving just the Mustang and specialty Ford GT among a host of SUVs and pickup trucks.

For 2022, Ford is bypassing major changes to the Mustang in favor of freshening the lineup with five new special-edition models. The Mustang is one of those rare vehicles that can justify a very wide price spread. A basic Mustang EcoBoost Fastback has a starting price of just over $28,000, while the Shelby GT500 has a base price of more than $70,000. Options can push that price to about $100,000.

In this era of crossover dominance, the Mustang has only two head-to-head competitors. The Chevrolet Camaro is most similar to the Mustang, and versions of both compete in NASCAR. The Dodge Challenger has a similar vibe but is larger than the Ford. In overall length, the Mustang is the same size as the Camaro but almost 10 inches shorter than the Challenger. The Mustang and Camaro are available in coupe and convertible versions, while the Challenger is only offered as a coupe.

name: 2022 Chevrolet Camaro
description:
Overview

The Chevrolet Camaro is a legendary muscle car that survives as Chevrolet turns its emphasis to trucks and SUVs. Exhilarating performance, striking styling, and modern technology make the big coupe fun to drive. But it is less enjoyable for daily errands thanks to its small cabin and tiny trunk. The Chevrolet Camaro is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 8 trim levels. The most popular style is the Convertible LT1, which starts at $41,395 and comes with a 6.2L V8 engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This Camaro is estimated to deliver 16 MPG in the city and 24 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Distinctive exterior styling
Excellent infotainment system
Impressive performance

Cons

Tight interior
Miniscule trunk
Electronic driver aids limited to upper trims

Overall Assessment

Available as a two-door coupe or two-door convertible, the 2022 Chevrolet Camaro is the latest edition of a model that dates back to the halcyon days of the 1960s. Not only was Flower Power all the rage, but sporty youth-oriented cars such as the Camaro were taking the market by storm. The Ford Mustang started the craze, but the Chevy Camaro was a fast follower and gave the Mustang a run for its money. Fifty years later, the American car market has changed, but the basic Camaro concept remains. The car is still a high-style rear-drive two-door that delivers sporty performance. Further, it is available in several variations — not only convertible and coupe but also with a bevy of engine choices.

The bedrock engine for the Camaro remains a big-displacement V8. Space efficiency was never one of the Camaro's strong suits, and that remains so today. The vehicle is a classic "2+2" designed to provide excellent accommodations for driver and front-seat passenger with rear seats that can hold two others in a pinch. The Camaro offers a large portion of driving fun even in its least performance-oriented trim. And at the top of the lineup, it provides performance only a handful of cars can match.

In terms of size, the Chevy Camaro and the Mustang are identical. The Camaro's other direct competitor is the Dodge Challenger, another highly styled two-door coupe. But the Challenger is almost 10 inches longer than the Camaro and offers a much more usable rear seat.

name: 2022 Mazda MX-5 Miata
description:
Overview

The Mazda MX-5 Miata is about as fun as cars get, especially for the cost. It's a quick, agile, open two-seater with a relatively low starting price. The Mazda MX-5 Miata is a 2-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the RF Grand Touring Automatic, which starts at $36,915 and comes with a 2.0L I4 engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This MX-5 Miata is estimated to deliver 26 MPG in the city and 35 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Extremely fun to drive
Strong acceleration and nimble handling
Convertible top is quick and easy to operate

Cons

Lacks interior storage
Outdated infotainment system

Overall Assessment

The Mazda MX-5 Miata is the quintessential two-seat sports car. It's quick, agile, and good-looking. More importantly it's a convertible, and there aren't many well-priced droptops left. With rear-wheel drive, a manual transmission, and a smooth, powerful engine, it's fun to drive, yet practical enough to be enjoyed everyday. No wonder it's one of the best-selling sports cars of all time.

The Miata is available in two styles: a traditional soft top convertible and the RF, which features a power-retractable roof panel. The standard cloth soft top can be lowered with one hand in a matter of seconds. The cabin is tight but comfortable. More interior storage space would be nice, but the Miata's small trunk is large enough to be useful for shopping bags or an overnight duffle bag. The suspension is very well-tuned, providing sports-car handling and a surprisingly smooth ride. There is no direct competitor for the Miata. The Ford Mustang and Chevrolet Camaro convertibles are much bigger. The BMW Z4 and Porsche 718 Boxster droptops are much more expensive. The Toyota GR 86 and Subaru BRZ coupes don't offer a convertible option.

name: 2022 Lexus LC
description:
Overview

Sold in coupe and convertible body styles, the Lexus LC's deluxe cabin and sleek exterior styling make it a standout among luxury sports cars. However, it's not as practical as some rivals due to limited cargo space and tight rear-seat legroom. The Lexus LC is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 2 trim levels. The most popular style is the LC 500 Convertible, which starts at $102,125 and comes with a 5.0L V8 engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This LC is estimated to deliver 15 MPG in the city and 25 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Head-turning design
Exquisitely crafted cabin
Impressive fuel economy from the available hybrid

Cons

Low on cargo space
Cramped rear seat
Rival models deliver sportier handling

Overall Assessment

Luxury sports cars balance opulence with performance, and the Lexus LC is a desirable pick in this segment. Dressed in the finest materials, its cabin is as plush as it gets. And its potent, standard V8 (a fuel-efficient hybrid powertrain is also offered) is a good match for the car's smooth handling and refined road manners.

On a less positive note, the Lexus LC isn't exactly brimming with utility. Other picks in this class have much more room for cargo; for example, the BMW 8 Series has more than twice as much cargo space as the LC. And if you're looking for a car that emphasizes athleticism, rival models like the Jaguar F-Type are more track-focused and spirited. Still, the swanky LC is a top choice if you need a high-end sports car that emphasizes style, luxury, and comfort.

name: 2022 Porsche 911
description:
Overview

With its celebrated heritage, iconic design, and unmatched driving experience, the Porsche 911 is a sports car that can be enjoyed every day. Plus, it's still a bargain relative to other high-performance luxury cars. The Porsche 911 is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 12 trim levels. The most popular style is the Carrera Cabriolet RWD, which starts at $115,350 and comes with a 3.0L H6 Twin-Turbo engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This 911 is estimated to deliver 18 MPG in the city and 24 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Iconic style and performance
Spectacular driving experience
Expansive lineup of available body styles and powerful engines

Cons

Insufficient interior storage
Short list of standard features
Overall Assessment
When you think Porsche, you think Porsche 911. For many, it has been the quintessential sports car since the 1960s. It continues to lead the industry with a unique combination of breathtaking performance, civility, and comfort that can be enjoyed every day, in all four seasons. Offered in 12 variations spread across three body styles — coupe, convertible, and Targa — there's a 911 to suit your desired level of performance with horsepower ranging from 379 to 640. Rear-wheel-drive and all-wheel-drive models are also available, and Porsche still offers some variants with a clutch pedal and an excellent seven-speed manual transmission. Most, however, are sold with Porsche's PDK automatic, which is considered the best dual-clutch gearbox available. Its desirability continues with its iconic design, modern interior, exceptional build quality, and back seat. Rivals include the supercars from McLaren, Ferrari, and Lamborghini, the Mercedes-Benz AMG GT, Audi R8, and grand tourers such as the BMW M8.

name: 2023 Chevrolet Corvette
description:
Overview

The Chevrolet Corvette has evolved over 70 years to become America's premier sports car with its mid-engine design and motorsport technology at a fraction of the cost of European rivals. The Corvette holds onto its heritage with the classic sounds of its V8, and power is still sent to the rear wheels. Chevrolet has improved its capacity as a daily driver with a luxurious cabin and modern interior features. The Chevrolet Corvette is a 2-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the Stingray 1LT Convertible, which starts at $73,095 and comes with a 6.2L V8 engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This Corvette is estimated to deliver 16 MPG in the city and 24 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Outsized performance. Comfortable daily driver. Race-inspired technology. Outruns far more expensive cars.

Cons

No manual transmission. Low-grade interior plastics. Few driver safety assists.
Overall Assessment
The Chevrolet Corvette is one of the sports car values of the century, offering the acceleration, handling, and braking one would expect in a car costing twice as much. The secret to its success is a redesigned chassis and mid-engine layout. The Corvette is pleasant enough to drive that it can be used daily, with a spacious cabin and pliant ride. The Corvette's weaknesses are few, but they exist–there could be more driver-assistance aids, and Chevrolet does not offer a manual transmission. Criticisms aside, the Corvette is the rare car that delivers monumental performance, stunning good looks, and surprising practicality and value.

name: 2022 Mercedes-Benz C-Class
description:
Overview

Redesigned for 2022, the Mercedes-Benz C-Class compact luxury sedan delivers a true European driving experience. The Mercedes-Benz C-Class is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the AMG C 63 S Cabriolet, which starts at $88,150 and comes with a 4.0L V8 Turbo engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This C-Class is estimated to deliver 17 MPG in the city and 24 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Attractive exterior design
Luxurious interior
Impressive fuel efficiency

Cons

Only the sedan model is updated for 2022
Active safety features cost extra
Overall Assessment
The all-new 2022 Mercedes-Benz C-Class sedan combines classic Mercedes styling with a design that emphasizes the car's timeless proportions. M-B designers have not bowed to the creased-and-folded craze that has taken hold at some other luxury manufacturers. Though a compact, the C-Class offers good accommodations for up to five adult passengers. Ride quality is a pleasant balance of comfort and handling. The C-Class' turbocharged mild-hybrid engine has virtually the same output as the competitive BMW 330i. It offers more horsepower than the base engine in the Audi A4 and the Cadillac CT4. Among this set, all but the A4 are rear-wheel-drive vehicles with optional all-wheel drive. The C-Class still offers coupe and convertible models, but they are carried over from last year, so they don't yet have the updated styling and features of the sedan.

name: 2023 BMW 8 Series
description:
Overview

Distinctive styling, a decadent interior, and thrilling performance make the BMW 8 Series a worthy flagship model for the German luxury brand. Tight rear seats and a steep price tag are the only reasons to hesitate if you're in the market for a high-end coupe, convertible, or sporty sedan. The BMW 8 Series is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the 840i Convertible xDrive, which starts at $100,995 and comes with a 3.0L I6 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This 8 Series is estimated to deliver 21 MPG in the city and 29 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Cabin looks and feels expensive
Strong, smooth performance from either engine option
Refined ride makes it comfortable for daily driving or long road trips

Cons

More expensive than some direct rivals
Some safety features are optional
Rear seats in coupe and convertible aren't big enough for adult passengers
Overall Assessment
Sitting at the top of the BMW lineup alongside the more traditional 7 Series sedan, the BMW 8 Series is a sportier take on top-end luxury and performance. Available as a two-door coupe, convertible, or low-roofed four-door sedan, the 8 Series has sensational performance to back up its exotic looks. From the base 840i to the top-end Alpina B8, the 8 Series is the kind of car that makes any trip feel special. Powerful engines assure pulse-quickening acceleration while the unflappable suspension smoothes out any type of road imperfections. A decadent interior completes the package as the cabin of the 8 Series is a step above the average luxury car. From the sleek design to the feel of the materials, every element of the 8 Series looks expensive. The only obvious flaw to the 8 Series is its size, as the rear seats in the coupe and convertible models are too small for adults. Even the four-door Gran Coupe model is tight in the back for taller passengers. It's a similar story when it comes to competitors such as the Mercedes-Benz SL, Mercedes-Benz CLS, and Audi S7, all of which sacrifice passenger comfort in the name of style.

name: 2022 Audi TT
description:
Overview

The TT offers a good blend of attributes to keep sports-car fans engaged. Its clean design and rich-looking interior are pure Audi. It is a fun-to-drive sports car, yet the rear seat and more conventional driving position make the TT practical for daily use, too. The Audi TT is a 2-seater vehicle that comes in 1 trim levels. The most popular style is the Roadster, which starts at $55,695 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This TT is estimated to deliver 23 MPG in the city and 30 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Iconic design
Standard all-wheel drive
Well-appointed interior

Cons

Less rewarding to drive than some sports cars
No manual transmission
Older than many competitors

Overall Assessment

The small Audi TT was unlike any other car when it arrived more than 20 years ago. It captivated enthusiasts with its tidy proportions, clean style, and a highly crafted interior. Now in its third generation, the current TT is still inspired by that very first model. And it has evolved in much the same way as the Porsche 911. The TT is handsome inside and out. Plus it offers a ride-and-handling balance skewed toward comfort. It's a car that's easy to live with.

Shopping for a TT is easy—there's just one engine and transmission choice: a 228-horsepower turbocharged four-cylinder mated to a dual-clutch automatic. And every TT is built with all-wheel drive. That really sets it apart from competitors as a true all-season sports car.

The TT is available as a coupe or a drop-top roadster with a full-power fabric roof and electronically adjustable wind deflector. We particularly like the roadster's silver metal roll hoops.

The TT is plenty quick. But to keep up with the higher powered optional engines from BMW and Porsche, you'll want to look at Audi's more powerful TTS or the nearly 400-horsepower TT RS. Most buyers will find the TT and TTS deliver enough excitement.

Audi has paired the TT to one basic trim, and just about everything comes standard. That contrasts with the Porsche 718 Cayman, whose many optional features drastically run up the sticker price.

name: 2023 BMW M8
description:
Overview

The BMW M8 offers spirited performance, luxurious accommodations, and body styles for varying tastes. However, its stiff ride quality makes it a less-than-ideal choice for daily commutes. The BMW M8 is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 1 trim levels. The most popular style is the Competition Convertible, which starts at $144,695 and comes with a 4.4L V8 Turbo engine and All Wheel Drive. This M8 is estimated to deliver 15 MPG in the city and 22 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Quick acceleration
Athletic handling
Different body styles

Cons

Tight rear-seat legroom in coupe and convertible models
Stiff ride
Rival models have more horsepower

Overall Assessment

The BMW M8 is a luxury sports car that gives you your pick of body styles. It's available as a coupe or a two-door convertible. And unlike its Audi R8 and Porsche 911 rivals, the M8 also comes in a relatively roomy four-door version. Regardless of which body style you choose, you'll enjoy a car with plush accommodations, sharp reflexes, and quick acceleration.

In the deficit column, the second-row legroom is cramped if you choose the coupe or convertible. And the trade-off for this BMW's sporty handling is a stiff ride quality that can be an annoyance in everyday driving. But overall, the M8 excels as a sports car that's agile and luxurious.

name: 2021 Ferrari Portofino M
description:
Overview

The Ferrari Portofino M is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 1 trim levels. The most popular style is the Convertible, which starts at $226,000 and comes with a 3.9L V8 Turbo engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This Portofino M is estimated to deliver 16 MPG in the city and 23 MPG on the highway.

name: 2022 Porsche 718 Boxster
description:
Overview

With its nimble chassis, powerful engines, and no-nonsense interior, the Porsche 718 Boxster is one of the purest sports cars that money can buy. That it's also one of the automaker's least-expensive models is icing on the cake. The Porsche 718 Boxster is a 2-seater vehicle that comes in 6 trim levels. The most popular style is the S Roadster, which starts at $75,950 and comes with a 2.5L H4 Turbo engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This 718 Boxster is estimated to deliver 19 MPG in the city and 24 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Sharp handling and design
Available flat-six engine delivers intoxicating power and sound

Cons

Minimalist cabin lacks storage and high-tech features
Price goes up fast with options
Overall Assessment
The 718 Boxster is Porsche's entry-level sports car. The drop-top two-seater shares its mid-engine platform and drivetrain with the Porsche 718 Cayman coupe. Both models rival the iconic Porsche 911 for driving engagement, despite costing tens of thousands less. That's thanks largely to the ideal weight balance provided by mounting its engine amidships, which not only helps the 718 Boxster achieve supercar-like agility but also delivers arias of internal-combustion music directly to your ears. Power is ample from the turbocharged four-cylinder engine, which is available in 2.0- and 2.5-liter versions making 300 and 350 horsepower, respectively. But the real magic comes from the optional 4.0-liter flat-six. It produces a generous 394 hp and sounds positively Wagnerian when revving to its 7800-rpm redline. Either mill can be fitted with a six-speed manual gearbox or Porsche's excellent seven-speed dual-clutch automatic (known as PDK). Inside the 718 Boxster, you'll find ample room for two. But that's about it. There's very little in the way of storage, and the otherwise high-quality cabin lacks much in the way of features — that is, until you start adding items from the (long) list of options. But we suspect that won't upset most buyers. After all, the point of the 718 Boxster is to thrill its occupants, not pamper them.

name: 2022 Audi R8
description:
Overview

The 2022 Audi R8 offers an intoxicating mix of supercar performance, sheer power, and eye-catching design combined with daily civility. It's a great choice for drivers who want to enjoy their supercar every day of the week. The Audi R8 is a 2-seater vehicle that comes in 2 trim levels. The most popular style is the V10 Spyder RWD, which starts at $162,395 and comes with a 5.2L V10 engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This R8 is estimated to deliver 14 MPG in the city and 23 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Supercar looks and speed
All-wheel-drive security
Comfortable enough for everyday driving

Cons

Minimal cargo space
Doesn't deliver the power and handling of some rivals
Overall Assessment
A six-figure two-seat mid-engine supercar with over 600 horsepower, the Audi R8 lives at the top of the Audi food chain. Supercars are all about sex appeal and speed, and the R8 delivers, rocketing from zero to60 mph in 3.6 seconds or less. It's thrilling to drive, and unlike some of its rivals, it's available with all-wheel drive. That adds some security to its handling, especially on wet roads. The R8, which is available as a two-seat coupe or convertible, is also civilized enough to drive daily thanks to a surprisingly roomy interior and brilliantly tuned suspension that provides a refined ride quality. Given the current state of high-performance car prices, the Audi R8 is also a bargain. Many rivals — such as the McLaren GT, Lamborghini Huracan Evo, and Ferrari F8 Tributo — cost considerably more. Even the Porsche 911 Turbo and Acura NSX Type S have higher base prices. The Chevrolet Corvette has the lowest horsepower rating and price of the pack.

name: 2021 McLaren 720S
description:
Overview

The McLaren 720S is a 2-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the Spider, which starts at $317,500 and comes with a 4.0L V8 Turbo engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This 720S is estimated to deliver 15 MPG in the city and 22 MPG on the highway.

name: 2021 Ferrari Portofino
description:
Overview

The Ferrari Portofino is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 1 trim levels. The most popular style is the Convertible, which starts at $217,004 and comes with a 3.9L V8 Turbo engine and Rear Wheel Drive. This Portofino is estimated to deliver 16 MPG in the city and 22 MPG on the highway.

name: 2023 MINI Convertible
description:
Overview

The Mini Convertible blends the fun of top-down driving with powerful engines and crisp handling. It's a joy on twisting country roads and easy to navigate through urban areas, too. However, it has a tight rear seat and minimal cargo room. The MINI Convertible is a 4-seater vehicle that comes in 3 trim levels. The most popular style is the Convertible S, which starts at $36,750 and comes with a 2.0L I4 Turbo engine and Front Wheel Drive. This Convertible is estimated to deliver 27 MPG in the city and 36 MPG on the highway.

Pros

Standout styling
Engaging drive
Powerful engines

Cons

Tight rear seats
Modest cargo capacity
All-wheel drive is not available

Overall Assessment

The Mini Convertible has seating for four people plus the sporty drive and undeniably cute styling of the Mini Hardtop. Its small dimensions mean there's not much room for cargo, and the rear seats are only suitable for younger kids. That's okay, though, because you don't buy a cute little convertible for its practicality. You buy a car like this for the fun factor, and the Mini Convertible delivers with responsive handling and powerful engines. The interior's visual appeal matches the car's attractive exterior. This isn't the roomiest convertible you can buy, but it's easily one of the most fun to drive; it will put a smile on your face whenever you see it in your driveway.

The Mazda MX-5 Miata also has attractive styling but seats only two people. The BMW Z4 is sleeker and more refined, with a focus on luxury performance. The Audi TT has a smooth ride and a beautiful and comfortable interior.
